alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:19AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jewell, Nuckolls, southeastern Webster and Thayer Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 419 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oak to near Ruskin to near Bostwick. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hardy around 425 AM CDT. Deshler around 430 AM CDT. Hebron, Byron and Lovewell State Park around 435 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Chester and Hubbell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
